page.title: 03Ampleforth Village.
page.content: Ampleforth's attractive appearance is derived from the small stone and pantile cottages and houses fronting the village street. Towards the centre of the village the street is flanked by wide verges on which trees have been planted. The village is the largest in the south western area of the National Park. Since it is also in the proposed Howardian Hills area of natural beauty there are planning controls on the freedom of people to put up new buildings or extend existing ones. Another problem which affects the village is the increase in Holiday cottages. Local people believe that these add little to the Economic or Community life of the village, and help to inflate house prices making it difficult for local young people to settle in the area.
